"I understand that the Tripreds are much more dangerous," Devilcat 
points out.  "But harsh experience has taught me never to discount an 
opposing force, no matter how weak it may seem.  If we focus all our 
attention on the Tripredacus forces, Hydras is free to strike as he 
chooses.  And I know from doing it myself how devastating that tactic 
is when done properly.  A better plan would be to wait for one or the 
other to make a move, then counter it."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil: Alright, but remember I have to talk to you as one 
officer
> to another.
> 
> Yggdrasil looked at Devilcat.
> 
> Yggdrasil: I don't want the Tripreds to take hold here, but I hope 
you
> see why they are the real threat, not the Preds.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > 
> > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > 
> > Rodimus gets up, looking to the guests on the otherside of his 
desk.
> > 
> > Rodimus Prime: If you'll excuse me, I have to go deal with this 
pod
> problem. If you need anything just contact Kup over the base comm
> system. He'll see that you get quarters or anything else you need.
> > 
> > Rodimus heads out of the base, transforming to car mode. He opens 
a
> comm to Rattrap.
> > 
> > Rodimus Prime: Rattrap, I'm waiting outside the base. Let's go get
> that pod.
> > 
> > Roddy then switches his comm to Nightlight's channel.
> > 
> > Rodimus Prime: Nightlight, honey, would you like to make a pod
> recovery run with me?
> > 
> > : : Kup : :
> > 
> > Kup: Katya, would you like to go present our plan to Rodimus now?
